data.title: Terrible Lunch
data.text:
We recently visited Yakima, WA  and stopped in at Jimmy John's for lunch. When we walked up to the counter the attendant just stood there and just starred at us until we asked if we could place an order. The attendant didn't greet us, or say welcome to Jimmy John's, or my I help you, just starred. 
The menu left a lot to be desired based upon what we were told prior to visiting the restaurant. When we finally decided we asked for chips and he pointed same went for napkins when we asked. Then we got our subs that took them less than I minute to make. The 8" subs were two prides of sourdough bread with 3 slices of bacon, a little bit of lettuce and two sliced tomatoes. We had to open the bread to see what was inside. Never have we had such a terrible lunch for $20.00.
We will never visit another Jimmy John's again and make sure our friends know of the terrible experience we had. Save your money and go somewhere that gives you a fair sandwich and service at a fair price.

data.title: Love Jimmy Johns
data.text: Great sandwiches and fast service.  Menu takes a while to figure out exactly what number sandwich you want to order. Consistently good and you can set outside when the weather permits.

data.title: Best sandwich shop in town
data.text: Great bread! They use REAL mayo! Always taste fresh and always taste good. Even like it for dinner sometimes!

data.title: Grand opening
data.text: Very disappointed that you have to buy a sandwich they have without changing it. And the most part is, not sure if they are going for the big city vibe but they are just plain unfriendly and lack customer service. If that's the image they are going for they do a great job!!

data.title: Tasty sandwiches!
data.text: I've been here several times and have always received friendly service and great sandwiches.  I've visited the downtown location and the new location on Nob Hill Blvd.

data.title: JJ's gets the job done again
data.text: The food hits the spot. Quick and tasty. Keep it simple. The service is quick, and the facilities are clean and in order.

data.title: poor excuse for sandwich shop
data.text:
Went in with the girlfriend for a bite to eat on her lunch break. we have always gone to Subway right across the street in the past, we want to try a change as we had heard great raves about Jimmy johns. 

well Jimmy Johns in not a Subway, no option of bread, no option of having it warm, no option of what you may or may not want on it. just order a stock off the menu sandwich.  you get it their way. Fine I can handle that ONCE.

After looking at the menu after we got the cold hard tasteless sandwich, we looked at the menu again and they do have option of extra stuff to be added of course the staff was in such a hurry to get us through the line and get back to yacking in the back they did not mention the options, the girlfriend and i after further looking found 2 menus and that they made wraps,

This would appeal to the girlfriend if we ever plan on going back, and that is NOT a plan we have. they had the one Chance to wow us but failed. I took 3 bites of my sandwich, than opened it up and ate the meat and cheese out and threw the rest away. See above bread HARD.   

will I ever go back not anytime soon.
